result.execSummary:
The defendant William F. Schraeder II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. William F. Schraeder II is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • William F. Schraeder II was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • William F. Schraeder II was found guilty of Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).
  • William F. Schraeder II was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 64 days served if probation is revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  
*  Pay fine of $300  and court costs including all applicable surcharges on each count.   
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.

Bond applied; partial refund.  ds/cp  ck# 15CH075377
Ct. 1
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Hilard Edwards.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Amended Information filed.  Count 1 - Dismissed on State motion.  Counts 2, 3, and 4 - Pleas of guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Sentences withheld, placed on probation for 18 months w/conditions.  Def. to receive credit for 64 days served if probation is revoked.  Cash bond to apply to fines & costs due; any balance may be returned to poster.

Parties are given a new trial date due to another trial that will begin today.  Jury Trial on 11/16/15 at 8:30 AM.  There will not be a jury status so parties are instructed to submit a letter or email on 11/12/15 regarding status of case.
